body.directions: Listen to the audio, then complete the multiple choice questions that follow.

body.quiz: Which of the following phrases is the most appropriate description of the word in audio?
body.correct: Very nicely done! 秃顶 tūdǐng means “bald.” Of the four choices, 没有头发 méiyǒu tóufà (doesn’t have hair) is the description that fits the best.
body.incorrect: So close! Listen to the word again to identify its meaning. Then check the choices to see which one gives the most accurate description.

body.quiz: In which of the following situations do some people most likely need assistance of the device referred to in the audio?
options: When we talk on the phone
body.correct: Excellently done! 眼镜 yǎnjìng means glasses. Some people who are nearsighted will need to wear glasses when driving a car.
body.incorrect: Not quite… listen to the word again to understand its meaning, and then read the situations in the choices to see in which one someone might need the device for.

body.quiz: Which of the following images best matches the word in audio?
body.answer: Image of something in grey color©iStock
options: Image of something in red color©iStock
Image of something in green color©iStock
Image of something in brown color©iStock
body.correct: Wonderful work! 灰色huīsè means grey. The image of the color grey in the choices best matches the word.
body.incorrect: Oops… listen to the audio a few more times to understand which color it refers to, and then match it to the images in the choices.

body.quiz: Which of the following items can be described, using the word in the audio?
body.correct: Terrific job! 白色 báisè means white, and a winter snowfall would perfectly match that color.
body.incorrect: Oops… listen to the audio one more time to identify the color, and then check the descriptions in the choices to see which one matches that color.

body.quiz: Which of the following is the opposite of the word in the audio?
body.answer: Audio for 小 xiǎo (small)
options: Audio for 冷 lěng (cold)
Audio for 热 rè (hot)
Audio for 凶 xiōng (mean)
body.correct: Job well done! 大 dà means “big,” and its opposite is小 xiǎo (small).
body.incorrect: Oops… listen to the audio again to understand what it means, and then listen to the adjectives in the choices to see which one is its opposite.
